shows the BiTeI single crystal which was grown by chemical vapor transport (CVT) (see methods).

, in which the substrate and the adlayer
spots are highlighted by the large and small hexagon, respectively. Epitaxial growth of BiI
thanks to a close structural match between the bulk structures. Both crystal structures can be viewed as hexagonal
close-packed arrangements of anions (either iodine or selenium) with cations (bismuth) occupying the octahe-
dral voids in a regular fashion. In the tetradymite-type structure, like Bi
axis are fully populated and each third row remains empty, thus forming a van der Waals (vdW)
[Se–Bi–Se–Bi–Se]. The latter are stacked in the
, 2/3 of the octahedral sites within each second row of cations along the stacking direction are occupied. In the

film is incommensurate with the substrate just like in the bulk case.
